newsitem.title: USA: German '96 tax income may not meet estimate - Waigel.
newsitem.headline: German '96 tax income may not meet estimate - Waigel.

text.p: German Finance Minister Theo Waigel said on Saturday he could not rule out that Germany's tax income may be slightly lower for 1996 than shown in the last estimate, published in May.

Waigel, in Washington for international meetings, was asked to comment on a report in German news magazine Focus which said that the May estimate would have to be revised down by two or three billion marks.

Making clear that he could only comment fully once figures from a new estimate are available in November, Waigel said, "No one can say how it will look. It is certainly possible that it could be slightly lower.
In May, federal tax receipts for 1996 were estimated at 340.1 billion marks. Total tax receipts, including state income, was assessed at 807.1 billion marks.
